title.label: It‚Äôs good but the real game is over due

content.label: It‚Äôs already 2019

Very impressed to encounter a mobile game similar in gameplay mechanics and ambience to that of Dark Souls. It is unclear what the storyline and purpose of the player‚Äôs journey in the game is supposed to be but there is a lot of potential here. This game is bound to cost money if it lives up to the quality in its lite version. 
The graphics are stunning, very pleasantly detailed and generally realistic in nearly every aspect. I would even consider recommending it based on visuals alone‚Äî absolutely outstanding in the realm of mobile games. My only suggestion for the visuals is regarding the realism of the blood. The blood‚Äôs red color is too bright and the way it is released from the monsters with each hack does not match the realism presented with the rest of the game‚Äôs artistic aspects. 
There are a lot of creative proponents too. In this game, once a monster reaches certain points in their health bar, you are presented with a sort of scene featuring the player making attacks not possible with the moves provided, giving you a visual break to just watch your player make some super cool attacks. It is unlike any other game I‚Äôve encountered in this respect, and it offers unique and refreshing perspectives to online battling. This is just one piece of evidence for the game‚Äôs creativity but it seems to be a good indicator that considerable thought is being placed into making it a high quality game that goes beyond what its influencers have done before.
I can‚Äôt find much to complain about, but I have some more small suggestions. Having a zoom in/ out option would be nice, especially when not battling. Planting objects and trinkets to find around the map would add depth to the game and storyline too. If finding and interacting with objects becomes a part of the game, it would be better to have the player have complete freedom when traversing the terrain (so he is able to run through grass and not be hindered from running off a road for example). It‚Äôs awkward but understandable that there‚Äôs a restriction to where the player can go and interact with in the lite version though. An option to not have the screen always locked on the player would be nice too. 

I‚Äôm glad I encountered Blade of God, and I look forward to when the full version is released on the App Store!

title.label: For a demo, it‚Äôs complete üÖ∞Ô∏è$$. Very disappointed!

content.label: Graphics are trash, sound is delayed, animation in cutscenes are choppy and low res. During execution cutscenes of four armed golem bosses, the same sound loop is played about five times *human yell, slice effect, monster groan* and after that, it‚Äôs just the monster control execution from God Of War 4. Also, the entire game reads like it‚Äôs translated from Somali to English. Very unprofessional in a literary standpoint. I understand that it‚Äôs just a demo, but it‚Äôs such an underwhelming experience.

title.label: It needs a lot of work.

content.label: It‚Äôs nothing like God of War or the other games it‚Äôs comparing itself to. Poor graphics, slow fighting attacks, just not impressed. It needs to have faster controls and a lot more polish. There is a game called Godfire and at first that‚Äôs what I was hoping for, but not close to that either. Descent idea though, probably some story line behind it. Godfire is quite difficult as well. These bosses did not even make me think, I‚Äôm dead. Sorry. Will not be buying this one.

This lite version constitutes a demo for a project reportedly coming sometime in 2018. While the gameplay is standard hack-n-slash fare, the graphics and design remind me of a cross between Castlevania and Dante‚Äôs Inferno. The only thing I absolutely hope the developer scraps entirely and begins from scratch is every single audio element in the entire game. Canned and disconnected, with so much dead air in between, combined with a hum-drum soundtrack leaves MUCH to be desired.

Advance the parkour 
Add some story( just a little bit not too much)
Try to add gashes when you have those killy little brutal boss cutscenes.
Maybe when the character throws an enemy, the enemy can collide with another enemy. Killing 2 birds with 1 stone. 
Thank you so much and please finish the game!
